approveMaximumOnPerpetual().details: Cannot be run in the constructor due to technical restrictions in Solidity.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

params.isBuy: True if the liquidatee has a long position, false otherwise.
params.liquidator: The account that performs the liquidation.
params.maxPosition: Maximum position size that the liquidator will take post-liquidation.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setInsuranceFee(uint256).details: Allows the owner to set the insurance fee. Emits the LogInsuranceFeeSet event.

params.insuranceFee: The new fee as a fixed-point number with 18 decimal places. Max of 50%.

setInsuranceFund(address).details: Allows the owner to set the insurance fund address. Emits the LogInsuranceFundSet event.

params.insuranceFund: The address to set as the insurance fund.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

approveMaximumOnPerpetual().notice: Sets the maximum allowance on the perpetual contract. Must be called at least once.

liquidate(address,address,bool,(uint256,.notice: Allows an account below the minimum collateralization to be liquidated by another account. This allows the account to be partially or fully subsumed by the liquidator. A proportion of all liquidation profits is directed to the insurance fund.

userdoc.notice: Proxy contract for liquidating accounts. A fixed percentage of each liquidation is directed to the insurance fund.
